author: pinkbulldeluxe1

text: Personally, I think it's unfair to compare Perfect Dark to Halo.  They don't play the same, don't have the same mood and one is mission based while the other is a lenghty campaign.  It is ironic that some people slam one dev but praise the other.  Rare did to the N64 what Bungie did to the original Xbox:  it prevented a console from being totally shred to pieces by the competition.

author: drunyon214

text:
Just beat this game the other day for the first time ever.  This track actually plays after the ending credits roll. Not a bad theme.

The campaign was pretty subpar and boring in this game, especially compared to its predecessor, but the multiplayer was superior to Goldeneye. The bots were a great addition. I think Goldeneye holds up better looking back, but Perfect Dark was the better game when it was released.
author: drunyon214

text: @SupraDarky Dude I played the CRAP out of this, and I never noticed the alien in her eye, here eleven years later.
author: Robert Dant

text:
Perfect Dark perfected every aspect of Goldeneye (except the story maybe). 
Soundtrack wise, I'll say both are pretty much on par. Both have very memorable songs, and the atmosphere they created are really appropriate with their respective game. I'll go with PD as the best OST, especially with the "X" version of some songs (Extraction!).
But I can't deny the power of some GE tracks (Silo or the Main Theme among others).

text: Perfect Dark had a ton of good music. Hope you upload some more.

text: Awesome game, though I didn't find it quite as good and memorable as Goldeneye. It has some pretty awesome music, which was expected from Rare games. Oh and I know some people who never noticed  the alien in Joanna Dark's eye. :P Speaking of her, I already mentioned it previously but she's voiced by Eveline Fischer, the composer of DKC3 and some of the music in DKC.
